blogContent:
Sarkari Admit Card 2025 - Government Exam Hall Ticket Download Portal

Your Direct Link Portal for Downloading Admit Cards for SSC, UPSC, RRB, Banking (IBPS/SBI), and All State PSC Exams. Get Ready for Your Exam!

The Admit Card, often referred to as the Hall Ticket or Call Letter, is the single most important document for any candidate appearing in a Government Exam. Without the Admit Card, entry into the examination center is strictly prohibited. It serves as proof of a candidate's identity, application acceptance, and contains crucial details like the Exam Date, Shift Timing, and the Examination Center Address.

At RozgarDesk.in, we provide the fastest and most reliable direct links to download all major Sarkari Admit Cards immediately upon their release by the respective recruiting bodies. This comprehensive guide covers the typical release timeline, the essential details required for download, and the critical information printed on your Hall Ticket.

Why the Admit Card is Your Most Important Document

1. Mandatory Entry Proof

The Admit Card is the only authorized pass for entry into the Examination Center. Without a printed copy, no candidate is permitted to sit for the Government Exam.

2. Identity Verification

It carries your personal details, photograph, and signature, which are cross-verified against the photo ID proof (Aadhar Card, Passport, etc.) at the gate and inside the exam hall.

3. Crucial Exam Details

It provides the final, confirmed information regarding your Exam Date, Shift Timing, reporting time, and the complete Examination Center Address.

Major Government Exam Admit Card Release Status

1. SSC Admit Card (CGL, CHSL, MTS, GD)

  • The SSC Admit Card is released region-wise (e.g., SSC WR, SSC NR, etc.) approximately 4 days before the Exam Date.
  • The Application Status (which contains exam city details) is usually released 7-10 days before the exam.
  • To download, you need your Registration Number and Date of Birth, or Roll Number.

2. Banking Admit Card (IBPS/SBI PO & Clerk)

  • IBPS and SBI usually release the Call Letter (Admit Card) 10 to 15 days prior to the commencement of the Prelims or Mains exam.
  • A separate Call Letter is released for the Prelims, Mains, and Interview stages.
  • Login requires the Registration Number/Roll Number and Password/Date of Birth.

3. RRB Admit Card (NTPC, Group D, ALP)

  • The Railway Recruitment Boards (RRB) release the Admit Card exactly 4 days before the respective CBT Exam Date.
  • The Exam City and Date intimation is provided about 10 days before the exam.
  • Candidates must download their specific RRB Admit Card from the official zonal website where they applied.

4. UPSC/State PSC Admit Card

  • The Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) and State PSCs (e.g., UPPSC, BPSC) generally release the Admit Card 2 to 3 weeks before the Prelims or Mains examination.
  • These often require only the Registration Number/Roll Number and Date of Birth for download.
  • It's crucial to check the details and report any discrepancy immediately.

Step-by-Step Guide: How to Download Your Sarkari Admit Card

  1. Visit the Official Portal: Go to the official website of the recruiting body (e.g., ibps.in) or use the Direct Link provided on RozgarDesk.in's Admit Card Section.
  2. Locate the Download Link: Look for the notification banner or link titled 'Download Admit Card for [Exam Name]' or 'Download Call Letter'.
  3. Enter Credentials: You will need your mandatory login details, typically:
    • Registration Number or Roll Number
    • Password or Date of Birth (in DD-MM-YYYY format)
  4. Verify Details: After logging in, check all personal details, the Exam Date, and the Examination Center Address displayed on the screen.
  5. Download and Print: Click on the download button (usually a PDF format) and take 2-3 Printouts of the Admit Card on an A4 sheet. Carry one for the exam and keep spares.

ðŸ’¡ IMPORTANT: The Admit Card must be printed clearly. Handwritten changes or blurred copies will not be accepted at the Examination Center.

Key Information Printed on Your Hall Ticket

Before heading to the exam hall, verify the following details on your downloaded Admit Card:

  • Candidate's Full Name (Must match photo ID)
  • Roll Number / Registration Number
  • Photograph and Signature (Must be clear)
  • Date and Time of Exam (D-Day and Shift Timing)
  • Examination Center Address (Full name and location)
  • Reporting Time and Gate Closing Time
  • Mandatory Instructions for the exam (e.g., items allowed/prohibited, documents required)

Don't Wait! Download Your Hall Ticket Now!

A common reason for exam-day stress is delayed Admit Card download. Avoid last-minute rush and technical glitches by downloading your Sarkari Admit Card as soon as it is released.

For Direct Download Links and Real-Time Alerts for every Government Exam Admit Card, rely on RozgarDesk.in instantly!

Extensive Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) about Sarkari Admit Cards

Q1. When is the Admit Card typically released?

The Sarkari Admit Card is usually released online, 7 to 15 days before the scheduled Exam Date. For bodies like SSC and RRB, it can be released as late as 4 days before the exam.

Q2. What credentials are required to download the Admit Card?

You primarily need your Registration Number/Roll Number and your Password or Date of Birth (DOB) as recorded during the application process.

Q3. What should I do if my name or date of birth is wrong on the Hall Ticket?

You must contact the recruiting body's helpdesk or the designated regional office immediately. Carry proof of the correct details (like 10th certificate) to the Examination Center and report to the invigilator.

Q4. Is the Admit Card sent by post?

No. For almost all major Government Exams (SSC, RRB, IBPS, UPSC), the Admit Card is released exclusively in online PDF format. Candidates must download and print it themselves.

Q5. What documents must I carry to the Examination Center along with the Admit Card?

You must carry the printed Admit Card, a Valid Photo ID Proof (in original), and a photocopy of the Photo ID. Often, 2-3 passport-size photos (matching the one on the Admit Card) are also required.

Q6. What is the difference between Exam City Intimation and Admit Card?

The Exam City Intimation is released earlier (10-15 days before the exam) to let candidates know their exam city for travel planning. The actual Admit Card (released later) contains the precise Examination Center Address and Shift Timing.

Q7. My download link is not working. What should I do?

Try downloading during off-peak hours (late night or early morning) as heavy traffic can crash the server. If the issue persists, clear your browser cache or contact the official recruitment board's technical support number.

Q8. Why is the SSC Admit Card released region-wise?

SSC releases the Admit Card through its nine regional offices (e.g., Central Region, Western Region) which manage the exams for the states under their jurisdiction. Candidates must check the website of the region they applied through.

Q9. What details should I check for on the Admit Card before printing?

Ensure the Roll Number, Exam Date, Shift Timing, and Examination Center Address are clear and match your expectations. The photo and signature must be visible.

Q10. Can I carry a soft copy of the Admit Card on my phone?

No. It is a mandatory instruction for nearly all Sarkari Exams to carry a Hard Copy (printed copy) of the Admit Card. Electronic copies are strictly prohibited as a form of entry proof.
